p: This exploratory study shows that rs638405, a BACE1 SNP previously associated with AD in both Caucasian [ 7, 8, 21] and Asian populations [ 22, 24, 25], is also associated with an increased risk of PD in the Norwegian ParkWest study ( Table 1). The link between BACE1 and PD is of clinical importance because of the essential role of BACE1 in the generation of toxic A β peptides [ 26], the observed A β pathology in PD [ 3, 4], and the recent association between detectable changes in A β levels and clinical features of PD [ 14, 27– 29].
